thread.title: Seahawks turn corners into goals, in 4-1 win
thread.title_full: Seahawks turn corners into goals, in 4-1 win

title: Seahawks turn corners into goals, in 4-1 win
text:
Seahawks turn corners into goals, in 4-1 win KEVIN PHILLIPS, SPECIAL TO THE NEWS JOURNAL 12:15 a.m. EDT October 9, 2015 Buy Photo Delaware Military Academy's Alvin Helley heads in the Daniel Rhodes' corner kick to tie the game in the 34th minute. DMA defeats McKean 4-1 at Midway Softball Complex Thursday. DANIEL SATO/THE NEWS JOURNAL Fullscreen Buy Photo McKean's Carlos Santana Mendez puts the Highlanders up 1-0 in the 15th minute against Delaware Military Academy. DMA defeats McKean 4-1 at Midway Softball Complex Thursday. DANIEL SATO/THE NEWS JOURNAL Fullscreen Buy Photo McKean freshman Carlos Santana Miller and Delaware Military Academy senior Jeremy Delfabbro jump for the ball. DMA defeats McKean 4-1 at Midway Softball Complex Thursday. DANIEL SATO/THE NEWS JOURNAL Fullscreen Buy Photo Delaware Military Academy senior Daniel Rhodes keeps control of the ball in the second half of DMA's 4-1 win against McKean at Midway Softball Complex Thursday. DANIEL SATO/THE NEWS JOURNAL DMA's Justin Broccoli, No. 10, heads the ball away from McKean's Carlos Santana Mendez. DANIEL SATO/THE NEWS JOURNAL DMA's Luke Perrone jumps over Ulies Guzman-Orozco in the first half. DANIEL SATO/THE NEWS JOURNAL McKean's Jose Parra keeps control of the ball in the second quarter. DANIEL SATO/THE NEWS JOURNAL DMA's William Hitchens dribbles past Osmar Tlaseca Rios. DANIEL SATO/THE NEWS JOURNAL DMA's Aleksander Kostyszyn and McKean's Jose Parra go up for the ball in the first half. DANIEL SATO/THE NEWS JOURNAL Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide Buy Photo Delaware Military Academy senior Daniel Rhodes keeps control of the ball in the second half of DMA's 4-1 win against McKean at Midway Softball Complex Thursday. (Photo: DANIEL SATO/THE NEWS JOURNAL) Buy Photo 
MILL CREEK Delaware Military Academy noticed that they had a height advantage over McKean, which it believed it could help them on set pieces in the teams’ nonconference boys’ soccer match Thursday. 
The Seahawks converted on two corner kicks late in the first half to turn a one-goal deficit into a one-goal lead before pulling away in the second half to earn a 4-1 victory at the soccer field at the Midway Softball Complex. 
“We have our own set plays and trying to kick it over there, trying to get a head on it and getting it on net. Their goalie didn’t exactly have the height advantage,” Delaware Military’s Aleksander Kostysyn said. “We were trying to get it in.” 
The Seahawks (8-2) trailed the Highlanders 1-0 in the 33rd minute when they were awarded their second corner kick of the day, and Daniel Rhoades took the kick to the goalkeeper’s right. 
Rhoades’s cross curved into the six-yard box, and freshman midfielder Alvin Halley outjumped everyone to head the ball into the net to tie the game at 1-1. Buy Photo 
DMA’s Alvin Halley heads in the Daniel Rhoades’ corner kick to tie the game in the 34th minute. DMA defeated McKean 4-1. (Photo: DANIEL SATO/THE NEWS JOURNAL) 
Riding the momentum from the goal, Delaware Military continued to pressure McKean, and, it earned another corner kick in the 40th minute. William Hitchens took the kick and crossed into the box, and a few seconds later, Kostyszyn emerged from traffic to kick the ball into the net to give the Seahawks a 2-1 lead. 
“It’s something that we work on in practice normally. Our starting central midfielder was out, so we had to make some adjustments,” Delaware Military Academy head coach Wayne Cox said. “That’s why it took us a while to get going. We tried get people moving and look for back posts, and that’s pretty much what happened.” 
The second half saw the Seahawks control possession with McKean (4-5) looking to counter to get the equalizer, but neither team could generate dangerous scoring opportunity over the next 30 minutes. 
In the 72nd minute, however, Luke Perrone passed it to an open Hitchens along the sideline, and he dribbled it down the field before passing it to Justin Carroll, who rocketed a shot into the net to give Delaware Military Academy a 3-1 lead. 
Rhoades capped off the victory for the Seahawks, converting a penalty kick in the final minute, and their strong closing stretch was a result of good passing that opened up the field. 
“We had good movement and spacing. Then we had some good touches,” Rhoades said. 
The Highlanders’ goal came in the 15th minute when Carlos Santana won a 50/50 ball before kicking it into the net. Read or Share this story: http://delonline.us/1Ll5GNE TOP VIDEOS
